com.ogprover.prover_protocol.cp
Class OGPCP

java.lang.Object
  com.ogprover.prover_protocol.cp.OGPCP

public class OGPCP
extends java.lang.Object

Class description:
Class for construction protocol - collection of construction steps and theorem statement

Version:
1.00
Author:
Ivan Petrovic

Field Summary
private  GeoTheorem algebraicGeoTheorem
          Geometry theorem from this Construction Protocol in algebraic form
private  java.util.Map<java.lang.String,GeoConstruction> constructionMap
          Map of construction steps - for easy search by label of constructed geometric object

          Array of construction steps
private  boolean hasFreeParametricSet
          Flag that determines whether CP contains some free parametric set or not

          List of NDG conditions associated with algebraic prover for this theorem.

          Number of zero indices used instead of u indices when instantiating points.

          Name of geometry theorem

          Theorem statement about objects constructed by construction steps of this Construction Protocol

public void clear()
Method for clearing of this CP.

addGeoConstruction

public void addGeoConstruction(GeoConstruction gc)
Method for adding one construction step to this construction protocol at the end

Parameters:
gc - Geometry construction to add into this protocol

addGeoConstruction

public void addGeoConstruction(int index,
                               GeoConstruction gc)
Method for adding one construction step to this construction protocol at the specified position

Parameters:
index - Index in construction protocol where to put new construction
gc - Geometry construction to add into this protocol

removeGeoConstruction

public void removeGeoConstruction(GeoConstruction gc)
Method which removes the construction from construction protocol.

Parameters:
gc - The construction to be removed. Note: the construction from CP has to be provided here, not a copy of it, since with non-overridden equals() it won't be found in CP.

addThmStatement

public void addThmStatement(ThmStatement statement)
Method to add theorem statement to construction protocol.

Parameters:
statement - Theorem statement to add to this construction protocol.

addNDGCondition

public void addNDGCondition(NDGCondition ndgCond)
Method to add NDG condition to construction protocol.

Parameters:
ndgCond - NDG condition to add to this construction protocol.

isValid

public boolean isValid()
Method that checks the validity of this construction protocol. Construction Protocol is considered valid if all points can be constructed from all other previously constructed points of that protocol. In short, each construction step must be valid. Also, theorem statement must be only about constructed objects.

Returns:
True if this protocol is valid, false otherwise

resetIndices

public void resetIndices()
Method that resets indices necessary for transformation of geometry points to their algebraic form (x and u variables).

decrementXIndex

public void decrementXIndex()
Method that decreases the value of index for dependent variables by one; it is used when it is decided to rename some recently introduced dependent variable so its index could be reused for the next dependent variable that is going to be introduced when instantiating some point.

incrementXIndex

public void incrementXIndex()
Method that increases the value of index for dependent variables by one; it is used when it is decided to undo renaming of some recently introduced dependent variable.

decrementUIndex

public void decrementUIndex()
Method that decreases the value of index for independent variables by one; it is used when it is decided to re-instantiate some recently introduced half-dependent point so same variable indices could be used.

incrementUIndex

public void incrementUIndex()
Method that increases the value of index for independent variables by one; it is used when it is decided to undo re-instantiation of some recently introduced half-dependent point.

setNumberOfZeroCoordinates

private void setNumberOfZeroCoordinates()

convertToAlgebraicForm

public int convertToAlgebraicForm()
Method for conversion of this construction protocol to algebraic form, used for algebraic prover methods

Returns:
SUCCESS on successful execution or general error otherwise

simplify

public void simplify()
Method which simplifies CP by removing all constructions that are not necessary for theorem statement.

instantiatePoint

public void instantiatePoint(Point P,
                             int pointType)
Method that assigns two UX variables to specified constructed point

Parameters:
P - The point that new variables will be assigned to its symbolic x and y coordinates
pointType - Type of instantiation: whether this point will be instantiated as free point (both coordinates will be u-variables) or as dependent point (both coordinates will be x-variables) or as half dependent point (only one coordinate is u-variable and another is x-variable); this value is one of POINT_TYPE_xxx values

instantiateCondition

public static XPolynomial instantiateCondition(SymbolicPolynomial condition,
                                               java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Point> pointsMap)
Method for instantiation of symbolic polynomial in x-polynomial.

Parameters:
condition - Symbolic polynomial representing the condition for some point
pointsMap - Map of points assigned to labels of common points from symbolic polynomial representing the condition, used for instantiation of that condition
Returns:
XPolynomial representing the algebraic form of condition or null in case of error

isPolynomialConsequenceOfConstructions

public boolean isPolynomialConsequenceOfConstructions(XPolynomial xpoly)

translateNDGConditionsToUserReadableForm

public int translateNDGConditionsToUserReadableForm()
Method that transforms all polynomial NDG conditions to user readable form.

Returns:
SUCCESS if successful, or general error otherwise

populateZeroPoints

private void populateZeroPoints()
Method that searches for all combinations of points whose at least one coordinate equals zero. E.g. if A, B and C are points with zero coordinate(s) then this method populates zeroPoints list with all combinations: A B C A B A C B C A B C

getPointsAssociatedWithVariables

public java.util.Map<UXVariable,java.util.Vector<Point>> getPointsAssociatedWithVariables(java.util.Vector<UXVariable> varList)
Method that retrieves lists of points associated to each of variables from passed in list. A point form this CP is associated to some variable if and only if it has been instantiated (i.e. variables have been assigned to its coordinates) and one its coordinate is equal to that specified variable.

Parameters:
varList - List of variables
Returns:
Map with lists of points associated to passed in variables; null in case of error
